lpool.logic

Enum Game.ProtocolCmd

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Game.ProtocolCmd>
      • lpool.logic.Game.ProtocolCmd
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Game.ProtocolCmd>
    Enclosing class:
    Game

    public static enum Game.ProtocolCmd
extends java.lang.Enum<Game.ProtocolCmd>
    Network communication protocol. Messages should begin with a number corresponding to the command position in this enum. Arguments should be separated by spaces and the message must end with a newline char.
    Author:
    Gustavo

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ANGLE
      Sent by the client during a play to inform where the player wants to aim the cue.
      BIH
      Sent by the server to inform the player he has to reposition the cue ball because the other player committed a foul.
      END
      Sent by the server to inform a client that the match has ended.
      FIRE
      Arguments: force(float(0 to 1)), x-spin(float(-1 to 1)), y-spin(float(-1 to 1)).
      JOIN
      Must be sent by the client in order to join the server.
      KICK
      Sent by the server to inform a client he has been kicked.
      MOVECB
      Sent by the client to move the cue ball when it is being repositioned.
      PING
      Echo request message.
      PLACECB
      Sent by the client to place the cue ball when it is being repositioned.
      PLAY
      Sent by the server to notify the player that it's his turn to make a shot.
      PONG
      PING response.
      QUIT
      Sent by the client when he wants to leave the game.
      WAIT
      Sent by the server to inform the player he has to wait for his turn.

      • ANGLE

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd ANGLE
        Sent by the client during a play to inform where the player wants to aim the cue. Arguments: angle(float).

      • FIRE

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd FIRE
        Arguments: force(float(0 to 1)), x-spin(float(-1 to 1)), y-spin(float(-1 to 1)).

      • PING

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd PING
        Echo request message.

      • PONG

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd PONG
        PING response.

      • JOIN

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd JOIN
        Must be sent by the client in order to join the server. Arguments: name(String).

      • QUIT

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd QUIT
        Sent by the client when he wants to leave the game.

      • KICK

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd KICK
        Sent by the server to inform a client he has been kicked.

      • MOVECB

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd MOVECB
        Sent by the client to move the cue ball when it is being repositioned. Arguments: x-pos(float(0 to 1)), y-pos(float(0 to 1)).

      • PLACECB

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd PLACECB
        Sent by the client to place the cue ball when it is being repositioned. Arguments: x-pos(float(0 to 1)), y-pos(float(0 to 1)).

      • PLAY

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd PLAY
        Sent by the server to notify the player that it's his turn to make a shot. Arguments: target(Match.PlayingForBall)

      • WAIT

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd WAIT
        Sent by the server to inform the player he has to wait for his turn.

      • BIH

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd BIH
        Sent by the server to inform the player he has to reposition the cue ball because the other player committed a foul.

      • END

        public static final Game.ProtocolCmd END
        Sent by the server to inform a client that the match has ended. Arguments: winner(boolean), reason(End.Reason).
